ygData.subject: Re: Bard petition ideas (Long)
ygData.msgSnippet: I suppose I should definetly feel for thee.  My RPG background is majorly from FF7, and games like Diablo (Hack n slash r us).  I am only 14 (age not level,
ygData.messageBody:
I suppose I should definetly feel for thee. My RPG background is majorly
from FF7, and games like Diablo (Hack n slash r us). I am only 14 (age not
level, hehe) so the D&D generation and its heavy RP'ing counterparts are
very pre birth :). I was quite harsh 3 or so hours ago but I have managed
to calm down :).

Gleeman, Half elven Bard of the 15th Chorus
Eq is a drug, and I need a fix
-----Original Message-----
From: SpudSucker <sprite@...>
To: eqbards@onelist.com <eqbards@onelist.com>
Date: Saturday, August 07, 1999 10:34 PM
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Bard petition ideas (Long)


>From: "SpudSucker" <sprite@...>
>
>
>-----Original Message-----
>From: silky@... <silky@...>
>To: eqbards@onelist.com <eqbards@onelist.com>
>Date: Sunday, August 08, 1999 12:08 AM
>Subject: Re: [eqbards] Bard petition ideas (Long)
>
>
>>From: silky@...
>>
>>
>>Spud, you have quite clearly outlined all the reasons I am NOT renewing my
>>EQ subscription.
>>
>>Indeed - had I known that what little else there was to do would be
>>destroyed so soon - I'd have never wasted my money in the first place.
>>
>>As a class, I too love my bard - but I hold Verant responsible for false
>>advertising. EQ is NOT a virtual world, it's a very pretty Quake - at
least
>>now.
>
>
>Actually the name is Sprite, just to lazy to change it in outlook. :P
>Anywho I do know how you feel, but coming from UO I was prepared. I run an
>online DnD game and am a PC in another so I guess I get my roleplaying from
>those. I play EQ for what it is, a major hack and slash game. I don't
play
>it nearly as much as I did, and because I just can't keep up with my
friends
>I may end up quitting sooner or later just because I wind up soloing all
the
>time.
>-Sprite
